decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with disruptive spells like Stifle and Force of Will, while also utilizing efficient creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure and end the game quickly. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower to close out games. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's game plan, with a focus on consistency and the ability to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland.

This deck aims to use the Doomsday combo to set up a win condition involving Thassa's Oracle. It includes various control spells such as Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect the combo, as well as card draw and tutoring spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for pieces. Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional utility and disruption. The deck also includes mana acceleration in the form of Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to help set up the combo quickly.

The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also has powerful threats like Reanimate, Roiling Dragonstorm, and creature finishers like Marang River Regent and Murktide Regent to close out the game. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for consistency and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of control elements and powerful win conditions.

This deck aims to win the game by quickly and efficiently milling the entire library to put Thassa's Oracle on top of the deck and win the game. The deck utilizes a combination of fast mana generation, free spells, and graveyard recursion to execute its game-winning combo. With a focus on speed and precision, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react, with the ultimate goal of executing a one-turn victory.

The deck focuses on efficiently milling Cephalid Illusionist with Nomads en-Kor to quickly fill the graveyard with Narcomoebas and use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for an instant win. It also utilizes control elements like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces. The deck runs a few utility lands and versatile cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Teferi, Time Raveler to provide additional value and disruption. Overall, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Nomads en-Kor to create a powerful card advantage engine. By repeatedly triggering Nadu's ability with the help of Nomads en-Kor, the deck aims to draw through the library quickly and efficiently to find key pieces and control the game. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal, as well as additional value cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler. The mana base is designed to support the combo and provide flexibility in casting spells.

The deck aims to quickly put powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by utilizing cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By accelerating its mana with Lotus Petal and City of Traitors, and interacting with the opponent's spells through Force of Will and Flusterstorm, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with its big creatures before they have a chance to respond. The inclusion of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Stock Up helps to protect and support the combo pieces, while also providing additional card advantage and disruption.

This deck focuses on rapidly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. Utilizing cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize to set up the graveyard, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent. Protection is provided through Force of Will and Daze, while card selection and manipulation are facilitated by Ponder, Brainstorm, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Fatal Push to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on using Cloudpost and ramping up mana quickly to be able to cast powerful spells and creatures like Karn, the Great Creator and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It includes cards like Crop Rotation and Ancient Stirrings to search for key lands and pieces, along with disruption cards like Bojuka Bog and Karakas to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and finish the game with a powerful attack or combo.

Utilizing various spells and abilities to quickly dump powerful creatures into the graveyard, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a swift and devastating victory. This deck focuses on efficient card draw and disruption to fuel its powerful combo plays, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By utilizing key cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Dauthi Voidwalker, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Cephalid combo by using cards like Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Shuko to mill the deck quickly. Once the combo is activated, the player can use Dread Return to bring Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield and win the game by having no cards left in the library. The deck also includes cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares for protection and disruption, as well as cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection and manipulation.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Entomb and Unmask, before bringing them back to the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures early in the game and disrupt their strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy. The deck aims to win the game through powerful combos and efficient reanimation plays, taking advantage of the graveyard as a resource for explosive plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing lands as control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also creating a powerful win condition with the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo. The deck includes various land tutors and mana acceleration to quickly assemble the combo, while also running disruptive cards like Pithing Needle and Grafdigger's Cage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game through mana denial and disruption until it can assemble its powerful win condition to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Nadu, Winged Wisdom in combination with Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling to create an infinite mana loop and draw the entire deck. By controlling the game with counter spells and removal like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and win the game in a single turn. The inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect the combo by bouncing problematic permanents and preventing opponents from interacting at instant speed.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and Glimmerposts, along with Urza's Tower and Grim Monolith, to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer. Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere disrupt opponents' spells, while Karn, the Great Creator can search for artifacts like Planar Nexus for extra turns. Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Ugin, the Ineffable provide additional control and removal options. The deck's win condition is to overwhelm opponents with big Eldrazi threats while controlling the game with disruption and mana acceleration.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bringing them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The key strategy is to cheat big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play early in the game, overwhelming the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. The deck aims to win through fast, explosive plays that can be difficult for the opponent to come back from.
